did.unittitle: John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale
did.abstract: Bill of sale for Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John Ditmars was commander of the Third Regiment of the New York State Militia from 1811 to 1814.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale, 1977.583, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Oppressive descriptive language was remediated from the title, finding aid title, preferred citation, abstract, and scope and contents notes in this finding aid as part of an anti-racist descriptive language audit performed in December 2020. The title of the related accession, EAD ID and location were not remediated.
This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bill of sale for transfer of Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825.
